title: Replication of financial derivatives under extreme market models given marginals. (arXiv:2307.00807v1 [q-fin.MF])
abstract: The Black-Scholes-Merton model is a mathematical model for the dynamics of a financial market that includes derivative investment instruments, and its formula provides a theoretical price estimate of European-style options. The model's fundamental idea is to eliminate risk by hedging the option by purchasing and selling the underlying asset in a specific way, that is, to replicate the payoff of the option with a portfolio (which continuously trades the underlying) whose value at each time can be verified. One of the most crucial, yet restrictive, assumptions for this task is that the market follows a geometric Brownian motion, which has been relaxed and generalized in various ways.  The concept of robust finance revolves around developing models that account for uncertainties and variations in financial markets. translated_abstract: Black-Scholes-Merton模型是描述金融市场动态的数学模型，包括衍生品投资工具，通过该模型的公式可以提供欧式期权的理论价格估计。该模型的基本思想是通过以特定方式购买和出售基础资产来对冲期权的风险，即通过一个资产组合来复制期权的回报，该资产组合在每个时间点的价值是可以验证的。这个任务的一个最关键但限制性的假设是市场遵循几何布朗运动，这种假设已经被放松和推广了各种方式。鲁棒金融的概念围绕着开发能够考虑金融市场的不确定性和变动的模型。利用鞍点翻转理论来推导的鲁棒金融模型是其中最重要的方向之一。在本文中，我们... (内容太长，后续省略)
tldr: 本文研究在给定边际分布的极端市场模型下，金融衍生品的复制问题。鲁棒金融模型是一种能够考虑金融市场不确定性和变动的模型， Martingale Optimal Transport是其中的重要研究方向。
